comments:
I'm trying to run Maven2 from inside Eclipse 3.1 using an External Tools launcher.   I have installed Maven2 to C:\java\maven-2.0.2, which means the executable is c:\java\maven-2.0.2\bin\mvn.bat.   I can successfully use the tool from outside Eclipse at the commandline, so the installation is sound.  The problem is, if I set up an External Tool launcher for this program, I get an error message when I try to run it:  "Exception occurred executing command line."   There is no associated detail.   

If I rename the directory to "C:\java\maven2" and point the tool at "C:\java\maven2\bin\mvn.bat", everything works great.  

The following is in my .log file after the error:

------------------------------------------------------
!MESSAGE Exception occurred executing command line.

!STACK 0

java.io.IOException: CreateProcess: C:\java\maven-2.0.2\bin\mvn.bat clean install error=0

	at java.lang.ProcessImpl.create(Native Method)

	at java.lang.ProcessImpl.<init>(ProcessImpl.java:81)

	at java.lang.ProcessImpl.start(ProcessImpl.java:30)

	at java.lang.ProcessBuilder.start(ProcessBuilder.java:451)

	at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:591)

	at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin.exec(DebugPlugin.java:746)

	at org.eclipse.ui.externaltools.internal.program.launchConfigurations.ProgramLaunchDelegate.launch(ProgramLaunchDelegate.java:152)

	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:590)

	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch(LaunchConfiguration.java:515)

	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch(DebugUIPlugin.java:733)

	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin$6.run(DebugUIPlugin.java:931)

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

Thank you for the bug report.
In the debug view, can you right click on the terminated and failed process associated with this launch, Properties>Command Line.
Could you paste the details here please.

I'm afraid that I don't get an entry in the list of launches in the Debug perspective when this fails.  When it successfully executes (with the c:\java\maven2 path), I get:

C:\java\maven2\bin\mvn.bat clean install

in the command line properties.
This works for me on 3.1.2 and 3.2.

Well, I'm not sure what's changed, but I'm no longer able to reproduce this bug either.  I'm now successfully launching Maven2 from c:\java\maven-2.0.2\bin\mvn.bat. 

Feel free to close this as WORKSFORME.
Thanks for the update. Works for me.
